title: 70's Pong system font
content:
I'd appreciate any help in identifying this font. I tried a number of sites, but the closest I could find was one called Zeppelin, but it was no match. Thanks.

[http://www.old-computers.com/museum/logos/match\_logo.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20111229204501/http:/www.old-computers.com/museum/logos/match_logo.gif "http://www.old-computers.com/museum/logos/match\_logo.gif")
author: Brutus

comments.content: An old face called Michel comes quite close, but that's about it.
Thanks. I tried to find it online, but no luck. Where I can get a look at this Michel font?

I found that one in [Rookledge's Classic International Typefinder](http://web.archive.org/web/20111229204501/http:/www.amazon.com/gp/product/1856694062/102-3064590-0553763?v=glance&n=283155&s=books&v=glance).

I think Mike Yanega has it in his Lined Font ID Guide as well.

- Lex

Am seeking the designer and type foundry (or issuer/producer) of:  
Brutus on page 232 of Rookledge Type Finder Number 582.

The design appears similar to Alburtus, No. 218 on page 74, a  
Wedge Serif Roman style.

Would appreciate a reply: [nbarsch@socal.rr.com](mailto:nbarsch@socal.rr.com)

Gary, is this related to the ‘Pong’ typeface mentioned above? If not, please start a new thread for your request:  
Go to the [Type ID Board](http://web.archive.org/web/20111229204501/http:/typophile.com/typeid) and follow the link that reads ‘Post new Forum topic’ – right beneath the headline.  
Thank you!
